intro: Stenostephanus puberulus, commonly known as the hairy stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Stenostephanus puberulus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
